page.title: 15THE CHURCH-INCE BLUNDELL
page.content: The village has strong Roman Catholic traditions and the parish church of the Holy Family has a thriving congregation. It is attached to{Ince Blundell Hall}and was given to the people of the village by the {Weld-Blundell}family. Before the Reformation, mass, for this area, was celebrated at Sefton Church, but after this Catholics had to worship in secret. During this time mass was said in a barn built in the shape of a cross, known to this day as the{Cross Barn.} This has recently been converted to a private dwelling. Mass is celebrated every weekday and three times on Sunday. Special services are held at Christmas,Easter and Harvest time. The Parish Priest is Father Michael Kennedy.
